title: Classic Baseball Legends
description: Step up to the plate and test your knowledge of baseball's greatest heroes from the golden age of America's pastime!

questions.question: Which legendary outfielder, known as 'The Say Hey Kid,' made a famous over-the-shoulder catch in the 1954 World Series?
Ted Williams was the last Major League Baseball player to bat over .400 in a season. What year did he accomplish this feat?
Which pitcher threw a perfect game in the 1956 World Series, the only one in World Series history?
Jackie Robinson broke Major League Baseball's color barrier in 1947 playing for which team?
Hank Aaron broke Babe Ruth's all-time home run record in 1974 by hitting his 715th home run. Which team was he playing for?
Which Hall of Fame pitcher, known as 'The Chairman of the Board,' won 236 games for the New York Yankees?
Sandy Koufax retired from baseball at the young age of 30 in 1966 due to what condition?
Which famous baseball duo played together for the New York Yankees and were known as the 'M&M Boys'?
Roberto Clemente tragically died in a plane crash on New Year's Eve 1972 while delivering aid to which country?
Which team won the 'Shot Heard 'Round the World' game in 1951 on Bobby Thomson's pennant-winning home run?
Stan Musial spent his entire 22-year career with which team, earning the nickname 'Stan the Man'?
Which pitcher was famous for throwing 'rapid Robert' fastballs and struck out 18 batters in a game in 1938?
The 'Miracle Mets' stunned the baseball world by winning the 1969 World Series. Who managed that team?
Which catcher, famous for his malapropisms and folksy wisdom, played in 14 World Series with the Yankees?
Ernie Banks, known as 'Mr. Cub,' was famous for what cheerful catchphrase?
